The BOID (Beliefs, Obligations, Intentions, Desires) architecture is a cognitive agent model that focuses on goal generation through the interaction of mental attitudes. Here are the key insights about BOID:
## Core Concepts
- BOID incorporates beliefs, obligations, intentions, and desires as primitive mental attitudes.
- Goals are generated from the interaction between these four mental attitudes, rather than being primitive or equated with desires.

context: I will discuss the research challenges in designing such human-aware AI systems, including
modeling the mental states of humans in the loop, recognizing their desires and intentions,
providing proactive support, exhibiting explicable behavior, giving cogent explanations on
demand, and engendering trust. I will survey the progress made so far on these challenges and
highlight some promising directions. I will also touch on the additional ethical quandaries that
such systems pose.
I will end by arguing that the quest for human-aware AI systems broadens the scope of AI
enterprise, necessitates and facilitates true interdisciplinary collaborations, and can go a long way
towards increasing public acceptance of AI technologies.
